description: seated nude (seated on a leaning against blocky structures) seen from PR side, holding a book in his PR hand; PR leg bent with foot to side; figure leans on PL elbow; slightly cartoonish face, looking out of picture plane
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

on back of mount, in pencil: [379], [Bartolomeo Schidoni 1570-1615], [20158432/95] and [033909/11 (crossed out) 379]
markings: LLC, stamped in black: [GL (monogram)]; LRC on mount, stamped in black: illegible; on back of mount, stamped in brown: [SCIPIO]
provenance: Luigi Grassi, Lugt 1171b (1858-1937), Florence. H. S. Reitlinger, Lugt 2274a (1882-1950), London. Mathias Polakovits, Lugt 3561 (1921-1987), Paris. Sale, Sotheby's, London, July 5, 2000, no.163, for Â£1,200, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (2000-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Seated Male Youth Reading a Book
